text:
Today, we have developed
a solution that provides

digital identity to all
children on the street.

By providing them
with a unique digital ID,

we can guarantee that these children
are recognised and protected.

At the Spanish Red Cross, our mission
is simple - no one should feel alone,

especially not the growing population
of elderly people in Spain.

Our team works
to reduce loneliness.
It's a pleasure to meet you.
ITWILLBE is dedicated to
accompanying local NGOs,

in order to help them do their
job better through
technology and innovation.

We are facing a
challenge in India right now,

where there are more than 10 million
children living on the streets,
to offer NGOs a way to identify them,

because if you are not identified you do
not exist, so they can be helped
and can receive basic services.

And, thanks to having participated
in the AWS Giveback initiative,
we are finding a solution.
It basically captures

facial biometrics of the child through
the use of artificial intelligence,

from Amazon and with that,
let's say, it gives

the childâ€™s face a
unique fingerprint
by which he or she then

can be uniquely identified
with the simple act of taking a photograph
wherever they go.
At the Spanish Red Cross,

how do you approach technology
applied to the problems of the elderly?
The Spanish Red Cross has been
a pioneer in the telecare service industry
for 30 years
by using telephones.

Older people find it difficult
to use technology
so the devices have to be very easy to use.

We have devices,
IoT sensors and devices
either by the Amazon Alexa device
or through a conventional telephone.

The Spanish Red Cross has been working
on this, developing solutions and

adapting devices so that
any interaction with someone

who might be in danger or even
just needs someone to talk to,

reaches our control centre 
and we can respond.
Roughly how many users do you have?

180,000 users benefit from this
service, which gives them independence

and also peace of mind that
they can live alone at home.

I would like to know what challenges
in terms of compliance you are facing
and how you manage them.

Thanks to the technological side and 
all the benefits that come from using

Amazon Web Services, from
the encrypted storage

to cyber-security and
infrastructure security.

How do you measure
impact when it comes
to deploying these kinds of
solutions for your recipients?
We measure it in two ways:
one, through weekly follow-ups to users.

We follow up on how 
the person is doing,
creating a familiar bond with the Spanish Red Cross
and we also measure the impact we make
in situations when they need us.
My father uses it,

so I think all the work you do
with older people is great.
At what point did you realise

that the technology problem 
for elderly people could have a future?

Let's see, we also realised this
from the evolution of the population.
Europe's population is ageing.

And then looking at the projection that by
2050 more than 9 million people
are expected to be over 65 years old,

was the moment we said
we have a future, we have to

to think about other solutions and
they have to be scalable.

That's when we discovered the cloud
and all that we could
integrate into future.
IoT,
artificial intelligence.
And I think that was the moment
to go for it and find a solution.

Pablo, I would like to know when
did you realise that cloud integration

and artificial intelligence driven, 
facial recognition
could help children.
Well, in this case, we did have
a lucid moment participating

in AWS PartnerEquip,
because the version that we had

used to be very
hardware-based and very specific.

We realised that the state 
of facial recognition,

and everything that is allowed,
was already in place

with sufficiently good rates
to make identifications.

All you need is a smartphone or tablet and
you just take a photo and that's it.

Also, costs are reduced, as there is
no longer an extra hardware cost.

This will allow us to grow faster, better
and provide a much better service,
both to NGOs and to the children themselves.
How do you envision the future of ITWILLBE?

We continue to believe that the use of
technology, the use of innovation,

is going to make an impact.
It's always going to make an impact.

I don't know what you have in store for
the future of the Spanish Red Cross.

We not only want to care for the
elderly, but also for people
who have difficulties in finding a job.

Incorporate services based
on artificial intelligence.

and see how technology can
help us serve all people.
